intro: Bulga brachystemon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bulga, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in heathland and open forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
